docs.lead_paragraph: The big news for women this week was new set of recommendations that most women can wait until age 50, rather than 40, to begin screening for breast cancer with mammograms. But there was another surprise in the new guidelines: a thumbs down to teaching women a simple, low-tech way to check for breast cancer -- the self-exam.
docs.abstract: Many women were confused by new guidelines that advised doctors against teaching breast self-exams.
docs.snippet: Many women were confused by new guidelines that advised doctors against teaching breast self-exams.

docs.lead_paragraph: The onslaught of television commercials against health care legislation has prompted a liberal advocacy group and two labor unions to begin a $1.7 million advertising campaign in favor of reform.

headline.main: New Ad Campaign Aimed at 13 House Members

docs.abstract: The onslaught of television commercials against health care overhaul legislation has prompted a liberal advocacy group and two labor unions to begin a new $1.7 million advertising campaign in favor of an overhaul.
docs.snippet: The onslaught of television commercials against health care overhaul legislation has prompted a liberal advocacy group and two labor unions to begin a new $1.7 million advertising campaign in favor of an overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Mary L. Landrieu, Democrat of Louisiana, has been cagey on how she will vote on a motion to bring up the big health care bill for debate in the Senate. But in a speech on the Senate floor on Wednesday morning, Ms. Landrieu, chairwoman of the Small Business Committee, suggested that government action was urgently needed and that she was willing to negotiate a bill - provided that controlling soaring health care costs for small businesses was a top goal.

headline.main: Defending Small Business, Eyeing a Big Vote

docs.abstract: Senator Landrieu, a pivotal Democrat, indicates her health care vote will depend in part on how well the legislation treats small business.
docs.snippet: Senator Landrieu, a pivotal Democrat, indicates her health care vote will depend in part on how well the legislation treats small business.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the short story "The Lottery,'' the author Shirley Jackson describes a small farming community in 1940s America, as picturesque a scene as anything you'd find in Norman Rockwell. It's "Lottery Day," and families gather in the June sun, the adults chatting while their children play, gathering up small piles of stones.
docs.abstract: The problem with playing the health care lottery: You're a winner and the system keeps you safe and whole, until it doesn't, writes nurse Theresa Brown.
docs.snippet: The problem with playing the health care lottery: You're a winner and the system keeps you safe and whole, until it doesn't, writes nurse Theresa Brown.

docs.lead_paragraph: People who are closely following the health care debate might not have to wait much longer for Senate Democrats to release their bill and for the Congressional Budget Office to assess its cost.

headline.main: The Early Word: Health Bill Buzz

docs.abstract: People who are closely following the health care debate might not have to wait much longer for Senate Democrats to release their bill and for the Congressional Budget Office to assess its cost.
docs.snippet: People who are closely following the health care debate might not have to wait much longer for Senate Democrats to release their bill and for the Congressional Budget Office to assess its cost.

docs.lead_paragraph: Given the drug industry’s last-minute price increases, the Senate should abandon its deal with the industry and impose tougher demands.
docs.snippet: Given the drug industry’s last-minute price increases, the Senate should abandon its deal with the industry and impose tougher demands.

docs.lead_paragraph: Three Senate Democrats are resisting a commitment to allow the Democratic health care bill to be debated on the floor.

headline.main: 3 Democrats Could Block Health Bill in Senate
headline.print_headline: 3 Democrats Could Block Health Bill In Senate

docs.snippet: Three Senate Democrats are resisting a commitment to allow the Democratic health care bill to be debated on the floor.

byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn and Robert Pear contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Much of the response to the new guidelines on mammograms has less to do with medicine than with a general approach to health care and to life itself.

headline.main: New Mammogram Advice Finds a Skeptical Audience
headline.print_headline: New Mammogram Advice Finds a Skeptical Audience

docs.snippet: Much of the response to the new guidelines on mammograms has less to do with medicine than with a general approach to health care and to life itself.

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Rebecca Cathcart contributed reporting from Los Angeles, Robbie Brown from Atlanta, and Dan Frosch from Denver.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite recommendations that women should start breast screening at 50, not 40, many doctors said they were not ready to make such a drastic change.

headline.main: Many Doctors to Stay Course on Breast Exams for Now
headline.print_headline: Many Doctors to Stay the Course on Breast Exams for Now

docs.snippet: Despite recommendations that women should start breast screening at 50, not 40, many doctors said they were not ready to make such a drastic change.

byline.contributor: Denise Grady and Anemona Hartocollis contributed reporting.
